snippet: Occupy needs to find new ways to gain attention or it will likely fade to the edges of the political discourse, supporters and critics said.
abstract: Both supporters and critics of the Occupy Wall Street movement say it needs to find new ways to gain attention or it will most likely fade to the edges of the political discourse; movement has seen a steep decline in visibility, leaving it without bases of operations in the heart of many cities.

byline.contributor: Erik Eckholm contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Occupy needs to find new ways to gain attention or it will likely fade to the edges of the political discourse, supporters and critics said.

headline.main: Less Visible Occupy Movement Looks for Staying Power
headline.print_headline: For Occupy Movement, a Challenge to Recapture Momentum
